content:
A. show that nobody is above temptation 
B. demonstrate that he controls the world 
C. lure Jesus Christ from his mission 
D. prove that after all, Jesus is only human. 
 
16. ‘ Foxes have holes, and birds of the air have nest; but 
the son of man has nowhere to lay his head.” 
The statement above implies that 
A. discipleship costs much 
B. the son of man need no house 
C. church buildings are unnecessary 
D. suffering is inevitable in life. 
 
17. According to Luke, following Jesus involves 
A. confession  B. self-denial 
C. baptism D. daily prayers. 
 
18. In the healing ministry of Jesus Christ, which of the 
following played a very vital role? 
A. Faith B.  Patience C. Love D. Repentance. 
 
19. Jesus healed the only son of the widow of Nain because 
A. the crowd pleaded with him 
B. the widow demonstrated faith in Him 
C. he had compassion on her 
D. he wanted to make people believe in Him. 
 
20. The healing of the paralytic brought by his four friends 
demonstrates  
A. the power of Jesus to heal all types of diseases 
B. that the friend had faith in the healing power 
of Jesus 
C. the compassion of Jesus on the sick man 
D. that Jesus has power to forgive sin. 
21. According to mark and Luke, the response of blind 
Bartmaeus to healing was to 
A. follow Jesus immediately 
B. run to show himself to the priests 
C. confess Jesus as a prophet 
D. speak to the Jew about Jesus 
 
22. The parable which teaches about God’s judgment is that 
of the 
A. sower B. lost sheep C. weeds D.  mustard  
seed. 
 
23. The parable of the good Samaritan implies that 
A. Samaritans always love their neighbours 
B. Priests and Levites hardly show love 
C. neighbourliness is expressed in love and 
concern 
D. a good neighbour must show love to his 
enemies. 
 
24. Luke ends the sermons on the plain with an analogy of 
a building to emphasize the importance of 
A. preaching and hearing the word 
B. hearing and obeying the word 
C. studying and doing the  word 
D. preaching and abiding by the word. 
 
25. Jesus implies in His teaching on adultery, prayer, alms 
and fasting that these are more of matters of 
A. the heart 
B. individual interpretation 
C. religious beliefs 
D. social norms. 
26. Jesus’ injunction not to lay up treasure on earth for 
ourselves implies that the Christian should 
A. not bank his money 
B. give his money to charity 
C. not be extravagant 
D. be rich in good works. 
 
27. The seventy disciples who returned from their 
missionary work were told by Jesus to rejoice because 
A. they were well received by people 
B. the spirits were subject to them 
C. their names were written in heaven 
D. they preached to many people. 
 
28. According to Matthew, when Jesus was transfigured 
A. his face shone like the sun 
B. his body became as white as light 
C. he could only communicate with heaven 
D. he saw Elisha and Moses. 
 
29. According to Matthew, Jesus entered Jerusalem riding 
A. a horse and a donkey 
B. an ass and a horse 
C. a colt and a donkey 
D. an ass and a colt. 
 
30. The prayer of Jesus before his arrest showed that 
A. he was sorrowful and troubled 
B. his disciples had not understood his 
thoroughly  
C. he was not prepared to die on the cross 
D. he wanted his disciples to be prayerful. 
 
31 “Are you the king of the Jews? 
Jesus’ reply to the question above by Pilate was 
A. “You have said so” 
B. “My kingship is not of this word 
C. “Who has made you a prince and a judge over 
us?” 
D. “Why put me to the test, you hypocrites?” 
 
32. According to Matthew, when the women went to see 
the sepulcher, the 
A. found that the disciples had been thee 
B. saw an angel sitting upon the stone 
C. met Jesus on the way 
D. found the guards rolling back the stone. 
 
33. Jesus used the illustration of the vine to teach that a 
Christian that abides in Him will surely 
A. be a good shepherd 
B. resurrect on the Last Day 
C. be a bread of life 
D. bear much fruit. 
 
34. Two of the seven disciple chosen to serve tables in the 
early church were 
A. Parmenas and Timon 
B. Mathias and Cornelius 
C. Nathaniel and Philip 
D. Stephen and Andrew 
 
35. “Give me also this power, that any one on whom I lay 
my hands may receive the Holy Spirit” 
A. very crafty B. money conscious 
C. ignorant D. fraudulent.
